definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to melt/to thaw/to blend/to merge/to be in harmony
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout

sentences.english: Not for him the rough and tumble of the financial marketplace.
sentences.chinese: 當然他也不會在金融市場裏瞎攪和。

sentences.english: What has shifted for the worse is financial-market sentiment.
sentences.chinese: 變得更糟的是金融市場的情緒。

sentences.english: My contention is that financial markets tend towards these strange attractors not to equilibrium.
sentences.chinese: 我的論點是金融市場趨向這些奇怪的引資者不平衡。

sentences.english: American lawmakers and law enforcers are busy with the housing finance market.
sentences.chinese: 美國立法機構和司法機構正忙於住房金融市場。

sentences.english: "Financial markets are poor multi-taskers, " Woo writes.
sentences.chinese: “金融市場的多任務處理能力較差，”吳寫到。

sentences.english: The central bank supervises and controls money market.
sentences.chinese: 中央銀行監督控制金融市場。

sentences.english: Oil's drop has been exacerbated by financial-market forces beyond falling demand.
sentences.chinese: 需求減少之外的金融市場力量加劇了油價的下滑。

sentences.english: And the financial markets blew a giant raspberry.
sentences.chinese: 也給金融市場吹來了一個大果子。

sentences.english: Re-imposing regulation on the financial markets will not be easy, in our view.
sentences.chinese: 我們認爲，重新加強對金融市場的監管並非易事。

sentences.english: This year relatively big fluctuations have cropped up on international financial markets. The U.
sentences.chinese: 今年國際金融市場出現較大波動。

sentences.english: The US financial markets are also stabilizing with positive signs in its economy.
sentences.chinese: 美國金融市場趨於穩定，經濟運行出現一些積極跡象。

sentences.english: Investors have confidence in the financial system and expect no trouble from their creditors.
sentences.chinese: 投資者對於金融市場有信心，並且不會被追債。

sentences.english: We're very active in the markets and so we established a Dealing Division.
sentences.chinese: 我們積極參與各種金融市場，爲此成立了交易部。

sentences.english: Last year's shocks have given way to a greater sense of stability in financial markets.
sentences.chinese: 金融市場去年的動盪，已讓位於一種更強的穩定感。

sentences.english: Markets have a way of undoing economic decrees.
sentences.chinese: 各金融市場素有抵消經濟政令影響的習慣。

sentences.english: He described the Fed as a type of superhero for financial markets.
sentences.chinese: 他把美聯儲描述成金融市場的超級英雄，無所不能。

definition: to undulate/to fluctuate/wave motion/rise and fall
to oversee/to take charge of/to supervise/to administer/supervisory/supervision
